page.title: 12 CASTLE CARY VINEYARDS.
page.content: Castle Cary Vineyards are on Honeywick Hill,between Bruton and Castle Cary.The vineyard was started in 1979 by Christopher and Gilly Woosnam Mills,with a planting of a quarter of a hectare of Muller Thurgau vines from Germany.Further vines were added in 1980 and the first harvest was collected in 1982,the first vintage. The vineyards now have another one and a half hectares of different German and French grapes.The vintages of 1983 and 1984 are a blend of grapes and the wine is a medium dry white with a fine bouquet and a fresh fruity taste,ideal for summer drinking,with a light meal or on its own. The vineyards do not make the wine themselves,but send the grapes to Nigel Godden at the Pilton Manor Vineyard.
